## Step 3: Calculate the total tax payable

Total tax payable = 1810.79 + 2956.22 + 998.49 + 3638.25 + 3720.32 + 1747.25 + 1761.05 + 3866.39 + 1738.99 + 5989.72 + 910.5 + 8781.98 + 9010.23 + 436.19 + 1748.84 + 8967.59 + 1935.67 + 914.84 + 1456.61 + 885.93 + 5153.67 + 1902.58 + 2954.99 + 443.51 + 4888.67 + 4256.21 + 872.04 + 1413.27 + 9823.45 + 9186.14 + 1976.6 + 906.85 + 5123.21 + 1770.31 + 5457.36 + 2597.76 + 13435.14 + 2965.95 + 4289.37 + 9002.98 + 14401.75 + 3750.52 + 499.6 + 966.56 + 903.1 + 452.58 + 9881.36 + 1869.41 + 2918.76 + 9408.87 + 13186.36 + 1951.72 + 916.33 + 2684.4 + 1760.95 + 1391.33 + 4272.96 + 890.64 + 461.49 + 498.68 + 921.87 + 8597.85 + 4891.59 + 8836.0 + 1993.4 + 1415.67 + 1456.68 + 1370.52 + 14476.89 + 4885.15 + 4670.6

This sums to approximately 271,550.92

## Step 4: Verify if there are any tax payments
I should check if there are any transactions where tax was paid, which would reduce the tax payable. However, I don't see any specific tax payment transactions in the data.

## Result
Since there were no tax payments made during the period, the increase in tax payable equals the total tax collected, which is 271,550.92.
